config.infinity.title: Infinite Dimensions
config.infinity.salt.description: This string will be added to the book text in the process of its conversion to the dimension ID. This can be used to ensure your dimensions are differing from dimensions with the same book text that other users generate. You can do this if you don't want to go into the mod already knowing "oh, the dimension 90 has diamonds" etc. Does not affect "easter egg"-type dimensions.
config.infinity.altarKey.description: This item was used to activate the Transfinite Altar, which was originally required to access modded content. Now, using this item on the altar can be used to play a fun animation.
config.infinity.portalKey.description: When set, this item is required to unlock Infinity Portals.
config.infinity.gameRules.longArithmetic: If enabled, this will expand the range in which dimension, biome and feature IDs generate from the integer limit (~2 billion) to the long limit (~9 quintillion). You know, if for some reason 2 billion dimensions is not enough for you :D
The maximum number of biomes allowed in a custom dimension.
config.infinity.gameRules.returnPortalsE: If enabled, every time you go through a portal from a custom dimension and generate a new portal, it will link back to a dimension you came from. If changed to false, all portals created this way will be normal Nether Portals.
config.infinity.gameRules.runtimeGenerat: If disabled, registration of dimensions and features in runtime will no longer occur, meaning you need to quit to title and enter the world again to access dimensions after tossing the book. Included for compatibility reasons.
config.infinity.gameRules.chaosMobsEnabl: If disabled, this mod's Chaos Mobs will no longer spawn, both in dimensions and inside your portals.
config.infinity.gameRules.forceSolidSurf: If enabled, non-full blocks will no longer be used as material for the surface of random biomes.
config.infinity.gameRules.consumePortalK: By default, the portal key is consumed when a portal is activated. This can be disabled, in cases where you want to keep the key.
config.infinity.rootChances.features_rul: This setting handles whether or not to try to generate vanilla, unmodified features alongside modded ones.
This setting handles the percentage chance that a block is rotated inside a feature.
This setting handles the percentage chance a geode is flooded with a random fluid.
This setting handles the percentage chance that vanilla trees generate instead of randomly generated ones.
This setting handles the percentage chance that huge trees generate. These are seriously huge, and are disabled by default for performance.
Normally, an ore checks if it's generating inside solid blocks. With this chance, it won't and you'll get them flying in the air.
This setting changes how often to toggle between "ore" and "scattered_ore" types of ore deposit generation.
When you have end spikes in a random dimension, this is a chance they will be all over the place like in pre-1.9 and not in a perfect circle.
This setting controls the percentage of spikes that have their end crystal in a cage.

This setting controls the chance that an End Gateway will teleport you to exact coordinates without regards to if you'll get stuck in a wall there. Otherwise, it will at least try to find a safe spot nearby.
This setting controls whether the large balls that spawn being of one random block or of a bunch of colored blocks.
This setting controls whether large balls made of coloured blocks are arranged in a perlin noise map or in diagonal bands.
config.infinity.rootChances.dimension_ty: This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where Piglins are not converted into Zombie Piglins.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where beds do not explode.

This setting controls the percentage of dimensions that are considered natural. In unnatural dimensions, compasses spin randomly and beds explode. In natural dimensions, Nether Portals can spawn Zombified Piglins.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where time does not pass.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where raids can take place.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where the camera is affected by a custom shader.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where water cannot be placed.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where Respawn Anchors will not explode.
This setting controls the percentage of dimensions where sunlight is applied.
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.use_ra: This setting controls the percentage chance to make a new random biome instead of choosing one from /modular/.../misc/biomes.json.
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.use_sp: This setting controls the percentage chance for a random biome to have individually standing sparse trees instead of being densely forested.
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.use_pa: This setting controls the percentage for biomes to have particles flying in the air, like in warped forests!
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.ambien: This setting controls the percentage for biomes to play ambient sound, constantly.
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.mood_s: This setting controls the percentage for biomes to play ambient sound, randomly (e.g. cave noises).
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.additi: This setting controls the percentage for biomes to play ambient sound, randomly.
This setting controls the percentage for biomes to play music, including custom music.
config.infinity.rootChances.biome.use_ra: This setting controls the percentage chance the mod will try to generate a random cave carver utility. These behave like legacy noodle caves from before 1.18, however the mod can throw in such wild values that the world becomes shredded.

This setting controls the percentage chance the mod will try to generate a random canyon carver utility. These behave like legacy noodle ravines from before 1.18, however the mod can throw in such wild values that the world becomes shredded.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.f: This setting controls the percentage that spawn_override settings are applied to the entire structure, or to parts of it.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.m: This setting controls the percentage that Mineshafts spawn with the Dark Oak variant.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.t: This setting controls the percentage that structure positions have smaller offsets than the usual uniformly distributed offsets from the points on a large grid.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.r: This setting controls the percentage that ocean ruins spawn with the sandstone variant.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.s: This setting controls the percentage that shipwrecks to spawn with the beached variant.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.p: This setting controls the percentage that ruined Portals to spawn with the blackstone variant.
This setting controls the percentage that ruined Portals to spawn with the overgrown variant.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.s: This setting controls the percentage that structures like Nether Fortresses spawn regular mobs instead of Blazes and Wither Skeletons.
config.infinity.rootChances.structures.p: This setting controls the percentage that ruined Portals to spawn with the vines variant.
This setting controls the percentage that ruined Portals to spawn with the cold variant.
config.infinity.rootChances.noise_settin: This setting controls the percentage chance that where stone would be in the world is instead a random block.
This setting controls the percentage chance that where dirt/grass would be in the world is instead a random block.
This setting controls the percentage chance that where lakes are composed of a random fluid.
This setting controls the percentage that a dimension is a Rift World, with 4 block gaps to the void on chunk borders.
This setting controls the percentage chance that where oceans are composed of a random fluid.
death.attack.infinity.world_ceased: %1$s was sent to the end of time
death.attack.infinity.world_ceased.playe: %1$s was sent to the end of time by %2$s
advancements.infinity.multiverse_start.d: Throw a written book into a nether portal.
advancements.infinity.book_box.title: Delving into chaos
advancements.infinity.book_box.descripti: Throw a bookshelf into your new portal
advancements.infinity.library.title: Ain't no way i'm reading all that
advancements.infinity.completion.title: Easter Egg Hunter
advancements.infinity.completion.descrip: Find all the secret dimensions of the multiverse!
advancements.infinity.multiverse.title: Across the multiverse
advancements.infinity.all_time.title: For all time. Always.
advancements.infinity.who_remains.title: They Who Remain
advancements.infinity.who_remains.descri: Survive three minutes in a crumbling world
emi.info.book_box: You can create a Box of Infinite Books by throwing a bookshelf into an Infinity Portal.
emi.info.altar: You can create a Transfinite Altar by throwing a lectern into an Infinity Portal.
emi.info.reset_charge: You can create a Reset Charge by throwing TNT into an Infinity Portal
